item.title: MRT7 trains to be seen running by April 2022
item.description: Trains of the Metro Rail Transit Line 7 are expected to be seen running by April 2022 as part of the test runs of the rail system after the initial shipment of trains arrived in the country from Korea last week, an official revealed Monday.

item.title: DOH not in favor of antigen testing requirement for Eleksyon 2022 candidacy filing
item.description: The Department of Health (DOH) on Monday recommended against requiring individuals who will participate in the filing of candidacy papers for the May 2022 elections to take a COVID-19 antigen test.

item.title: Michael Yang denies financing Pharmally, says money came from 'friends'
item.description: Former presidential economic adviser Michael Yang on Monday said it was his "friends" who helped Pharmally Pharmaceutical Corporation with its finances in purchasing COVID-19 supplies last year.

item.title: Too early to say if COVID-19 alert level in NCR could be extended -DOH
item.description: The Department of Health (DOH) said Monday it was too early to make predictions on the National Capital Region's (NCR's) COVID-19 alert level in the coming days.

item.title: Palace: Pacquiao s Eleksyon 2022 presidential bid as PDP-Laban standard bearer still uncertain
item.description: Malacañang said Monday that it is not yet certain that Senator Manny Pacquiao will be the presidential candidate of ruling party PDP-Laban which has two factions, one led by the lawmaker and another by Energy Secretary Alfonso Cusi.

item.title: DepEd vows action vs. online class cheaters
item.description: The Department of Education said Monday that students who have resorted to online cheating will be held accountable.

item.title: Duque: RITM looking into alleged 'inaccurate' results of PRC COVID-19 tests to health personnel in Subic
item.description: The Research Institute for Tropical Medicine (RITM) is looking into an incident in Subic wherein some hospital personnel tested positive for COVID-19, however, a retest three days later yielded negative result.

item.title: Police find body 'consistent with' Gabby Petito in Wyoming
item.description: Crews searching a national park in Wyoming for missing Gabby Petito found a body "consistent" with the 22-year-old woman in a remote area on Sunday but have not yet made a formal identification, the FBI said.

item.title: Philippines approves limited face-to-face classes
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte has approved the conduct of limited face-to-face classes in areas with minimal risk of COVID-19 infection, Malacañang and Education Secretary Leonor Briones announced on Monday.

item.title: DOH: 319 new Delta cases detected, variant now most common lineage
item.description: The Department of Health said Monday that the highly transmissible Delta variant of the coronavirus is now the most common lineage among sequenced samples of COVID-19 cases in the Philippines.

item.title: OCTA reiterates COVID-19 cases in NCR may have peaked; DOH says not yet
item.description: The rise in COVID-19 cases in the National Capital Region may have already peaked, independent expert group OCTA Research reiterated on Monday.

item.title: House leader seeks abolition of PS-DBM
item.description: Deputy Speaker Rufus Rodriguez is seeking for the abolition of the Procurement Service of the Department of Budget and Management (PS-DBM), the office currently at the center of congressional investigations on allegedly questionable purchases of medical supplies.

item.title: Isko Moreno confirms meeting with Robredo, Pacquiao ahead of Eleksyon 2022 filing of candidacy
item.description: Manila Mayor Isko Moreno on Monday confirmed that he had a meeting with Vice President Leni Robredo and Senator Manny Pacquiao ahead of the filing of candidacy in October for Eleksyon 2022.

item.title: Ex-ICC judge: Public, social media statements can be used as evidence in ICC drug war probe
item.description: Public statements of Philippine government officials, including those made on social media, are admissible evidence before the International Criminal Court (ICC), retired ICC judge Raul Pangalangan said Monday.

item.title: Edgar Erice leaves Liberal Party in favor of Aksyon Demokratiko
item.description: After 18 years, Caloocan City Representative Edgar Erice on Monday decided to leave the Liberal Party as he transfers to the Aksyon Demokratiko.
